The **wumpus**, q, is a monster that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)
- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [3 Origin](#Origin)
- [4 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)
- [5 References](#References)

## Generation

The wumpus is randomly generated at a relatively rare rate, though not nearly as rare as other monsters.

Wumpuses generated at level creation have a 4⁄5 chance of being [asleep](/wiki/Asleep "Asleep"); any wumpuses generated after level creation after you have picked up the [Amulet of Yendor](/wiki/Amulet_of_Yendor "Amulet of Yendor") will always generate awake.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

The [Ranger quest](/wiki/Ranger_quest "Ranger quest") locate level will always generate a wumpus on the downstairs.

## Strategy

The wumpus is very slow, but has a strong bite attack and can cling to ceilings, allowing it to generate over and move past [moats](/wiki/Moat "Moat") without [drowning](/wiki/Drowning "Drowning") or being relocated. Even so, its sluggish movement makes it an easy target for any player with good kiting or ranged attacks at their disposal, and it has no resistances whatsoever to boot.

While not particularly desirable as a [pet](/wiki/Pet "Pet") due to its extremely low speed, the wumpus's clinging ability allows you to [ride](/wiki/Ride "Ride") a pet wumpus over water.

## Origin

This monster is derived from the early [text adventure](/wiki/Text_adventure "Text adventure") game *[Hunt the Wumpus](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hunt_the_Wumpus "wikipedia:Hunt the Wumpus")*; the Ranger quest locate level that it appears in is an homage to the game.

## Encyclopedia entry

The Wumpus, by the way, is not bothered by the hazards since he has sucker feet and is too big for a bat to lift. If you try to shoot him and miss, there's also a chance that he'll up and move himself into another cave, though by nature the Wumpus is a sedentary creature.

\[ wump (6) -- "Hunt the Wumpus" ]

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [makemon.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 1035](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.4.3/makemon.c#line1035 "Source:NetHack 3.4.3/makemon.c")

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.6. Click here for more information.](/images/5/57/Nh366-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.6. Click here for more information.")

Wumpus

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
q wumpus
Difficulty 9
Attacks Bite 3d6
q wumpus
Difficulty 9
Attacks

Bite 3d6

Base level 8
Base experience 118
Speed 3
Base AC 2
Base MR 10
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 1 (Very rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 2500
Nutritional value 500
Size Large
Resistances None
Resistances conveyed None

A wumpus:

  • can cling to the ceiling.
  • has no hands.
  • is an animal.
  • is omnivorous.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • is strong.
  • can be seen through infravision.
Reference monst.c#line767

The wumpus, q, is a monster that appears in NetHack.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Strategy
  • 3 Origin

Even so, its sluggish movement makes it an easy target for any player with good kiting or ranged attacks at their disposal, and it has no resistances whatsoever to boot.

While not particularly desirable as a pet due to its extremely low speed, the wumpus's clinging ability allows you to ride a pet wumpus over water.

The Wumpus, by the way, is not bothered by the hazards since he has sucker feet and is too big for a bat to lift. If you try to shoot him and miss, there's also a chance that he'll up and move himself into another cave, though by nature the Wumpus is a sedentary creature.

The '''wumpus''', {{monsym|wumpus}}, is a monster that appears in ''[[NetHack]]''.

==Generation==
The wumpus is randomly generated at a relatively rare rate, though not nearly as rare as other monsters. 

Wumpuses generated at level creation have a {{frac|4|5}} chance of being [[asleep]]; any wumpuses generated after level creation after you have picked up the [[Amulet of Yendor]] will always generate awake.{{refsrc|makemon.c|1035}}

The [[Ranger quest]] locate level will always generate a wumpus on the downstairs.

==Strategy==
The wumpus is very slow, but has a strong bite attack and can cling to ceilings, allowing it to generate over and move past [[moat]]s without [[drowning]] or being relocated. Even so, its sluggish movement makes it an easy target for any player with good kiting or ranged attacks at their disposal, and it has no resistances whatsoever to boot.

While not particularly desirable as a [[pet]] due to its extremely low speed, the wumpus's clinging ability allows you to [[ride]] a pet wumpus over water.

==Origin==
This monster is derived from the early [[text adventure]] game ''[[Wikipedia:Hunt the Wumpus|Hunt the Wumpus]]''; the Ranger quest locate level that it appears in is an homage to the game.

==Encyclopedia entry==
{{encyclopedia|
The Wumpus, by the way, is not bothered by the hazards since he has sucker feet and is too big for a bat to lift. If you try to shoot him and miss, there's also a chance that he'll up and move himself into another cave, though by nature the Wumpus is a sedentary creature.
|[ wump (6) -- "Hunt the Wumpus" ]
}}
